newsitem.title: NEW ZEALAND: BIL expects satisfactory 1996/7 earnings.
newsitem.headline: BIL expects satisfactory 1996/7 earnings.

text.p: Brierley Investments Ltd said on Thursday that its present expectation was that earnings from operations would in the current year be "satisfactory".
BIL earlier reported a NZ$310.3 million profit for the June year, down from $431.7 million.
BIL said the new financial year had started well with Thistle Hotels maintaining its strong growth in earnings.
Sky City had achieved its initial forecast and was expected to perform strongly during the current year, BIL said.
Some of the New Zealand busiensses, including Air New Zealand, were experiencing more difficult trading due to the slowdown in the local economy and the strong New Zealand dollar.
"However, the present expectation is that earnings from operations will, in the current year, be satisfactory," BIL said.
Investment contributions would again depend on assets sales being undertaken on their wider merits, BIL said.
